title: Bachelor In Paradise's Tayshia Adams confirms she's split from John Paul Jones
text:
They broke up and then got back together on the season six finale of ABC's Bachelor In Paradise that aired in September.

But now, it seems, Tayshia Adams, 29, and John Paul Jones, 24, are done for good.

Adams posted a photo of the couple to her Instagram on Wednesday and in the caption, she posted a long message explaining that the relationship is over.

'Open and honest': Bachelor In Paradise's Tayshia Adams posted a long message to Instagram on Wednesday in which she confirmed her relationship with John Paul Jones is over

Adams, who lives in Orange County in Southern California, and Jones, who is from Maryland, had been maintaining a long-distance romance.

But Wednesday, Adams explained she needed to share what had happened with fans who 'had been a part of our journey from the beginning......in order to heal and move on.'

'John and I had something incredibly special. We fell for each other in Paradise, and everything was a whirlwind after that,' she wrote.

'When the show ended, I truly went back to Maryland to see if what we had was something we could build on without cameras, a production crew, and without feeling any pressure: to simply figure things out on our own terms,' she added.

'But the reality was, we were living on opposite coasts, and working insane schedules that made it impossible to see each other and build a life with each other.'

Fan favorites: Adams, 29, and Jones, 24, broke up on a beach in Mexico during season 6 of BiP but later reunited during the three-hour season finale that aired in September

'Incredibly special': The reality TV couple had maintained a long distance relationship but in the end, Adams said, it was ' impossible to see each other and build a life with each other'

Adams shared: 'We truly did the best we could, but at this time have decided that what is best for the both of us is to go our separate ways.'

'We are the best of friends and will continue to remain in each other’s life because regardless of the situation, we make each other happy.'

Jones left a simple red heart emoji in the comments section of Adams' post.

UsWeekly reported that the financial analyst and former Bachelorette contestant also commented on the breakup during an appearance on the podcast Reality Life with Kate Casey.

'Tayshia and I met last Friday, but we have so much going on in our personal lives it is very difficult to focus on a serious relationship,' Jones said.
